page.title: 06The Parish Council
page.content: In such a rural area, the Parish Council plays an important role in settling local disputes and dealing with local issues. Members of the local Parish Council are often also members of the District Councils. The benefit of this is that Parish matters can be put into a wider and more influential context. In Ranton Parish, for example, there are three hundred names in the Parish Register as opposed to 140 in 1947. Meetings are held monthly in the Village Hall. Councillors are elected every four years but as there are usually few new candidates forthcoming the personnel of the Parish Council becomes well-established.
